properties.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 9 at 11:46AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
A band of heavier snow showers will move across western Nevada
into the early afternoon hours.

Areas from Reno to Fernley to Fallon and south to Carson City,
Virginia City, and Yerington have the best chances of seeing a
quick light accumulation through 1 PM today. This includes
Interstate 80 east of Reno, Highway 580 in Washoe Valley, and
Highway 50 east of Carson City to Fallon. Accumulations will range
from a dusting up to a quick half inch in these areas. We can't
rule out spots of near one inch snowfall mainly on non-paved
surfaces.

Expect sudden changes in weather and road conditions into the
early afternoon. Some light accumulation is possible on untreated
roadways and bridges. Check road status and traffic before
heading out and allow some extra time for travel.

NWSheadline: Snow Squall Moving through Western Nevada
